spacing-px.$description: Horizontal spacing for the page container.

spacing-py.$description: Vertical spacing for the page container.

hero.$description:
Extra-large display typography for high-impact visual elements. Establishes the primary focal point while maintaining readability across devices. Use with appropriate spacing to create breathing room around this dominant element.

Common uses: Landing page main headlines, Marketing campaign banners, Product feature introductions, Welcome screens, Section dividers in long-scrolling pages.

section.$description:
Primary organizational heading that creates clear content boundaries. Establishes consistent rhythm through proper spacing relationships with surrounding elements. Maintains sufficient contrast with body text while creating a harmonious scale progression.

Common uses: Main topic dividers in articles, Dashboard section headers, Product category headers, Page-level navigation anchors, Form section dividers.

subsection.$description:
Secondary heading for logical grouping within larger content sections. Creates clear visual hierarchy through weight and size contrast while maintaining typographic cohesion with section headings above it.

Common uses: Sub-topics within longer articles, Feature description headers, FAQ question headings, Setting category labels, Card headers in grid layouts.

base.$description:
Versatile heading for content organization at the paragraph level. Provides subtle visual separation while maintaining content flow. Creates recognizable signposts for scanning without overwhelming surrounding text.

Commin uses: Small widget headers, Related content groups, List section headers, Step-by-step instructions titles, Table headers.

small.$description:
Compact heading treatment that maintains hierarchical presence while optimizing for space efficiency. Uses increased weight to compensate for reduced size, ensuring sufficient contrast with body text.

Common uses: Data visualization labels, Small card titles.

normal.$description:
Core reading typography optimized for extended content consumption. Balances character density, line height, and spacing to reduce eye fatigue across different screen sizes and reading environments.

Common uses: Main content, Product descriptions.

strong.$description:
Emphasized body text that creates focal points within content flow. Uses increased weight rather than size to maintain vertical rhythm and paragraph cohesion while drawing attention to key information.

Common uses: Important warnings or notices, Key points in explanatory text, First sentences in important paragraphs, Feature highlights.

code.$description:
Monospaced typography that ensures character alignment for technical content. Maintains consistent spacing and character width to preserve code formatting while integrating harmoniously with surrounding text.

Common uses: Code snippets and examples, Terminal command instructions, File paths and system references, API endpoints.

Common uses: Code snippets and examples, Terminal command instructions, File paths and system references, API endpoints.

normal.$description: Component-optimized text style with zero line-height for precise vertical positioning. Designed specifically for UI elements with fixed height constraints where text must maintain consistent vertical alignment.

strong.$description: Emphasized component text for important interactive elements. Increases visual prominence without affecting component height. Ensures consistent vertical alignment within fixed-height UI elements.

normal.$description:
Supporting typography for contextual information and annotations. Creates clear visual separation from body content through size contrast while maintaining readability for explanatory text.

Common uses: Image descriptions, Chart legends and labels, Source attributions, Supplementary clarifications, Figure captions.

soft.$description:
Reduced-emphasis supporting text for secondary information. Creates visual hierarchy through weight reduction while maintaining size consistency with normal captions. Visually recedes while remaining accessible.

Common uses: Timestamps, Metadata displays, Copyright information, Secondary attributions, Optional information.

normal.$description: Component-specific annotation style with zero line-height for precise positioning. Designed for compact UI elements requiring single-line supporting text with consistent vertical alignment.

soft.$description: Minimal-emphasis component text for auxiliary information. Combines reduced weight with zero line-height for the most visually subtle typography suitable for non-critical interface elements.

default.$description:
Interactive text treatments that provide consistent affordances across the interface. Maintains typographic harmony with surrounding content while clearly signaling clickable elements through subtle decoration changes.

Common uses: In-paragraph text links, Navigation menu items, Action links in content, "Learn more" expansions, Related content links.

default-underline.$description:
Default size link, hover state.

Common uses: In-paragraph text links, Navigation menu items, Action links in content, "Learn more" expansions, Related content links.

sm.$description:
Small size link. Interactive text treatments that provide consistent affordances across the interface. Maintains typographic harmony with surrounding content while clearly signaling clickable elements through subtle decoration changes.

Common uses: In-paragraph text links, Navigation menu items, Action links in content, "Learn more" expansions, Related content links.

sm-underline.$description:
Small size link, hover state.

Common uses: In-paragraph text links, Navigation menu items, Action links in content, "Learn more" expansions, Related content links.

title.$description:
Prominent typography for modal interface headers. Creates immediate context for interrupting content while establishing visual hierarchy within the dialog component.

Common uses: Confirmation dialogs, Settings modals, Feature popups, Alert notifications, Form submission dialogs, Drawers.

h1.$description:
Primary document heading that establishes the main topic with prominent visual weight and size. Creates the top level in document hierarchy.

Common uses: Document titles, Main article headings, Tutorial titles, Report titles.

h2.$description:
Secondary heading for major content divisions. Creates clear breaks between primary sections while maintaining hierarchical relationship with H1.

Common uses: Chapter divisions, Major content sections, Topic groups, Process divisions.

h3.$description:
Tertiary heading for smaller content groupings. Provides additional organization while preserving clear hierarchy within document structure.

Common uses: Subtopics, Feature headers, Step groupings, Related concept clusters.

lead.$description:
Introductory paragraph with increased size for document openings. Sets context and summarizes key information.

Common uses: Article introductions, Executive summaries, Feature overviews, Tutorial introductions.

paragraph.$description:
Standard typography for document body content. Optimized for comfortable reading with appropriate spacing and line height.

Common uses: Main content, Explanations, Process descriptions, Detailed information.

emphasized.$description:
Highlighted paragraph style for important information. Uses increased weight to create focal points without disrupting content flow.

Common uses: Important notices, Key takeaways, Warnings, Summary points.
